result.execSummary:
The defendant JaJuan Q. Shaw was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: CONCURRENT to sentence currently being served

**11-05-15/ Judge M Joseph Donald**
The Court ordered that the term of Probation is commuted to 3 years.

miscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample; pay surcharge. Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs by the end of probation period; any remaining balance to convert to civil judgment. Cash bail applied.
Defendant is informed he may not possess and/or own any firearms. Defendant is informed he may not vote in any election until his/her civil rights have been reinstated.
COURT FINDS THAT EXPUNGEMENT WOULD NOT BE AGAINST PUBLIC INTEREST IF EACH AND EVERY CONDITION OF PROBATION IS COMPLETED INCLUDING COSTS, FEES, SURCHARGES, AND ASSESSMENTS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION/EXTENDED SUPERVISION, if Revoked:
- Obtain AODA assessment and complete follow-up care/treatment.
- Absolute sobriety cooperate with random urine screens.
- No illegal drug dealing or association with drug community (drug users/dealers/houses).
- Cooperate with all rules deemed appropriate by Dept. of Corrections.
- No Contact with N. G. or her residence or her family.

filed by defense.

Defendant JaJuan Q. Shaw in court with attorney Thomas E. Hayes.  Defendant JaJuan Q. Shaw in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

AS TO COUNT 1:    Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Case adjourned to 10-15-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court for Sentencing Hearing.
Court CANCELLED the 10-12-2015 at 9:00 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant was taken into custody in Manitowoc to begin serving a sentence and was not produced for today's hearing.  Defense requests a final pretrial and jury trial.

 Per Chief Judge Directive of 15-10, parties are advised that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Branch 02, Judge Joseph Donald, in Room 506 of the Safety Building.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 7, 2015 at 09:00 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 12, 2015 at 09:00 am.
